bioghist.p: Agi Jambor (1909-1997) was an Hungarian American concert pianist and professor of music. She taught at the Philadelphia Musical Academy, the Peabody Conservatory of Music and was the founder of the Music School at Oak Ridge, Tennessee. She came to Bryn Mawr as a visiting professor in 1957, and was appointed Professor and Director of Ensemble Groups the following year. She remained at Bryn Mawr until her retirement in 1977. Her first husband was Dr. Imre Patai. Patai died in 1949. She was later married to the actor Claude Rains. The couple divorced in 1960.

scopecontent.p: The collection includes Jambor's correspondence (incoming and outgoing); documentation of her concert career, including concert programs and newspaper clippings; autobiographical writings; Jambor's musical compositions; lecture notes for courses on music interpretation and criticism; music scores; one reel to reel recording of Jambor's first concert at Carnegie Hall, 1949; scrapbooks; photographs; memorabilia of Claude Rains; letters, scientific papers, and a diary kept by her husband Imre Patai; and drafts from a book project, scientific works, and letters of her close friend, Dr. Egon Orowan (1902-1989). Many documents in the collection are in Hungarian or German.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.
